case_vignette: A 70-year-old man is brought to the emergency department because of severe back pain that began when he was lifting a box 1 hour ago. He also has a 2-year history of increasingly severe right hip pain. Physical examination shows tenderness to palpation of the lower spine as well as erythema of the skin over the right hip. Neurologic examination shows decreased hearing in the left ear; the Weber test localizes to the left side. Serum studies show an alkaline phosphatase concentration of 410 U/L, calcium concentration of 9.5 mg/dL, and parathyroid hormone level of 322 pg/mL. An x-ray of the spine shows a fracture of the L4 vertebra.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

I have severe back pain that started an hour ago when I was lifting a box and I've also been experiencing increasingly severe pain in my right hip for the past two years.

The patient also reports having increasingly severe pain in the right hip for the last two years. The patient has not been diagnosed with any bone or joint conditions yet.
trial_2.vignette_mcq: Osteonecrosis. The other conditions listed, such as osteitis deformans (Paget's disease), osteoporosis, and osteitis fibrosa cystica (tuberculosis), have different clinical presentations and laboratory findings.
trial_2.vignette_frq: The most likely diagnosis is a vertebral osteoporotic fracture with associated hip fracture and possible parathyroid hormone (PTH) related peptide (PTHrP) mediated hypercalcemia. trial_2.summarized_mcq: Osteonecrosis. The sudden onset of severe back pain along with a long-standing hip pain suggests the possibility of osteonecrosis, which is the death of bone tissue due to lack of blood supply. This condition can affect any bone in the body, including the hip and spine. Osteitis fibrosa cystica, on the other hand, is a complication of diabetes that affects the pancreas, not the bones. Osteitis deformans is Paget's disease, which is a chronic bone disorder characterized by abnormal bone growth and remodeling. Osteoporosis is a condition characterized by weakened bones and an increased risk of fractures.
trial_2.summarized_frq: Based on the given symptoms, the most likely diagnosis is a herniated disc in the lumbar spine.
